snippet: Gov. Gray Davis signed landmark legislation on Saturday to outlaw the harassment of gay students and teachers in public schools and colleges, calling the action an effort to ''beat back the forces of hatred.''    Mr. Davis, a Democrat, also signed...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Gray Davis signed landmark legislation on Saturday to outlaw the harassment of gay students and teachers in public schools and colleges, calling the action an effort to ''beat back the forces of hatred.'' Mr. Davis, a Democrat, also signed into law a state domestic partners registry for couples who are homosexual or over age 62, extending hospital visitation rights and allowing state and local government workers to get health benefits for their partners.
abstract: Gov Gray Davis signs landmark legislation outlawing harassment of gay students and teachers in California's public schools and colleges (S)

headline.main: California Moves to Extend Gay Rights With New Laws
